headline: CarMax Stock Ends the Week With Another Drop
summary: CarMax , the biggest seller of used cars, wrapped up a tough week Friday with its shares down 23% over the past five sessions. Most of the decline came Thursday, when the company said its sales and profits plunged in the latest quarter.

headline: Analysts turning bearish on CarMax after weak quarter
summary: Investing.com -- CarMax shares came under fresh pressure after CFRA and Oppenheimer cut their ratings on the used-car retailer, after disappointing quarterly earnings, weakening sales trends, and execution missteps.Shares were down 2% in premarket trading on Friday.

raw.headline: Analysts turning bearish on CarMax after weak quarter
raw.summary: Investing.com -- CarMax shares came under fresh pressure after CFRA and Oppenheimer cut their ratings on the used-car retailer, after disappointing quarterly earnings, weakening sales trends, and execution missteps.Shares were down 2% in premarket trading on Friday.

headline: CarMax Short Sellers Mint $171 Million in One Day From 20% Drop
summary: For short sellers, the one-day paper gain was worth $171 million, according to Matthew Unterman, managing director at S3 Partners.  It’s a worrying signal for long-only investors amid growing concern about CarMax’s place in the auto industry which is being buffeted by the Trump administration’s tariff policies.  “Many investors underestimated how much of CarMax’s earnings were being pulled forward through its own finance arm,” said Brad Lamensdorf, co-portfolio manager of AdvisorShares Ranger Equity Bear ETF.

headline: CarMax (KMX) Falls to All-Time Low as Q2 Earnings Disappoint
summary: We recently published 10 Big Names Investors Are Dumping. CarMax, Inc. (NYSE:KMX) is one of the companies that heavily bled in Thursday’s trading. Shares of CarMax fell to an all-time low on Thursday, as investors disposed of positions after disappointing second-quarter earnings results. headline: Heard on the Street Thursday Recap: Intel Wants a Bite From Apple
summary: Intel shares surged on reports that it is seeking more investments.  The money-losing chipmaker has approached Apple and TSMC about potential investments or partnerships.  Intel's shares surged 9%, making it the top performer in the S&P 500.

headline: KMX Q3 Deep Dive: Margin Pressures and Demand Headwinds Dominate Management’s Focus
summary: Used automotive vehicle retailer Carmax (NYSE:KMX) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales falling 6% year on year to $6.59 billion. Its GAAP profit of $0.64 per share was 38.1% below analysts’ consensus estimates.
